author: Sonam Saigal
text:
NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal’s plea for temporary bail to celebrate Holi was rejected on Wednesday by the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court.

Mr. Bhujbal was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on March 14 and was sent to judicial custody on March 17 for bringing a loss of Rs. 887 crore to the State exchequer. He is currently lodged in the Arthur Road Jail.

It is alleged that the Bhujbals accepted money from contractors for awarding projects and this was then channelled into various companies they controlled.

“Under PMLA, there is no provision for granting such a bail… therefore the grounds mentioned are not sustainable,” ED’s lawyer Hiten Venegavkar told the court.
title: Bhujbal’s bail plea rejected
